title: Bolton woman left 60 bags of stinking rubbish to rot in own backyard for months
text:
Bolton woman left 60 bags of stinking rubbish to rot in own backyard for months Tenant taken to court after disgusted neighbours complain of flies and a strong smell. Share Rachel Moden left 60 bags of stinking rubbish in the yard of her home in Moorfield Grove, Tonge. (Photo: Bolton Council) Share   Thank you for subscribing!   
A woman who left more than 60 bags of stinking rubbish to rot in her own back garden for months has been fined hundreds of pounds. 
Rachel Moden ignored repeated requests from Bolton council to get rid of the bin bags, which were attracting flies and emitting a strong smell in the backyard of her rented property in Moorfield Grove, Tonge. 
The 25-year-old was prosecuted by the council’s Housing Standards team following complaints by disgusted neighbours. 
She was first asked in June last year to remove the rubbish, but when inspectors returned a month later it was still there. 
Moden was served with official notices requesting it be disposed of, but she failed to clear it up. By August, it had still not been moved and the council stepped in to remove it. 
Moden failed to attend Bolton Magistrates Court last week to answer to the charges and the matter was proved in her absence. Read More Teenagers 'high on laughing gas' throw chairs and smash window in McDonald's 
She was found guilty of failing to comply with an abatement notice and was fined £440. She must also pay court costs of £266 and a £44 surcharge. 
A further £514.22, which is how much it cost the council to get rid of the rubbish bags, will also be recovered from Moden. 
Bolton council’s cabinet member for housing, Coun Elaine Sherrington, said: "There is simply no excuse for dumping rubbish in this way and these cases show how the actions of one or two residents can affect an entire community." Carmen Baker dumped rubbish, including a sofa bed, outside her house in Brandwood Street, Rumworth, Bolton. (Photo: Bolton Council) 
Carmen Baker, of Brandwood Street, Rumworth has also been fined as part of Bolton Council’s ongoing crackdown on rubbish and fly-tipping. 
The 45-year-old dumped several bags of rubbish, carpet oddments, furnishings, and a sofa bed in the rear yard of her rented house. She too ignored several warnings and the council ended up removing the rubbish itself. 
Baker was fined £440, in her absence, and ordered to pay court costs of £245 and a victim surcharge of £44. Clean up costs will be recovered from Baker as well. Read More Man who killed tragic mum was one of the ringleaders in Strangeways riots 
Coun Sherrington said: “We gave both occupiers numerous chances to sort this out and co-operate with us but they took no action. We have also contacted the landlords of these properties to make them aware of the issues. 
“We are grateful to the public for being vigilant and reporting these cases to us. We will prosecute when requests and warnings are ignored.” 
Complaints about waste on private land, including properties, should be referred to the council’s Housing Standards team on 01204 336500. Like us on Facebook
